title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Cannot open file in another editor if already opened in one editor
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If a file is already opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor and should give an error message.
OB: When a java file is opened in the workbench and then an attempt is made to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With .. System Editor', nothing happens. The workbench should display a warning message that states that the user may overwrite changes and asks if they want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, indicating that all files need to be closed first. This behavior is believed to be a safety feature in which the software does not allow external editing while the file is already opened in the workbench.
EB: When a java file is already opened in the workbench, if an attempt is made to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking on the file and selecting 'Open With .. System Editor', the workbench should display a warning message asking the user if they want to continue and indicating that their changes may be overwritten. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed, instructing the user to close all files before proceeding.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all java files.
2. In the Java Perspective, right click on the java file.
3. Select 'Open With .. System Editor'.
4. Observe that nothing happens and there is no warning or error message displayed. The file should not open in another editor.
